alert.note: Alert for Arkansas; Jefferson; Lonoke; Monroe; Prairie (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 13 at 2:44PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Prairie, southeastern Lonoke, southwestern Monroe, north central Jefferson and northern Arkansas Counties through 315 PM CDT... At 244 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Humphrey, or 8 miles southwest of Stuttgart, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Stuttgart... Humphrey... Almyra... Ulm... Roe... Brummitt... Stuttgart Municipal Airport... Wabbaseka... Aberdeen... Almyra Airport... Casscoe... Lawrenceville... Crocketts Bluff... Bayou Meteo State Game Area... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 PM CDT for central and southeastern Arkansas. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for eastern and southeastern Arkansas.
